page.title: 12TYNE VALLEY RAILWAY
page.content: The railway line was fully opened 139 years ago, but Prudhoe Station did not open until later. The line is used by over 50 passenger and goods trains daily (fewer on Sundays). Not all of the trains travel the full distance between Newcastle and Carlisle as some stop at Hexham. Passengers mostly pay on the train because the ticket office at Prudhoe closed several years ago. Most travellers were happy with the service, but some were not happy about cleanliness on the trains. The trains were usually on time, except those from Carlisle which were sometimes a little late. The station has unfortunately been vandalised and the furniture is covered in graffiti. Nowadays, only the three signalmen work at the station whilst a driver and conductor operate the trains.
